citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female bichon (Angel, Microchip#0A02236321, DOB 5/28/2013) was observed to have 3 teeth that were loose to the
touch (her upper left front tooth, upper left back tooth, and her lower right back tooth (premolar). On physical exam, the
attending veterinarian noted that her dental score was a 3 (out of 1-3) and body condition 6/9 on 1/5/23; however the
licensee said that they have not discussed a treatment plan with the attending veterinarian for the advanced dental
disease. Dental disease with teeth that are loose to the touch could become worse or could be uncomfortable for the dog
and impact its overall health if not properly treated. The facility must have this dog's teeth evaluated by the attending
veterinarian for treatment and follow the treatment plan.
***Correct by March 8, 2023.
The bottle of pyrantel in the fridge had an expiration date of 7/14/22 and the licensee said it has been used for dogs in the
facility. Expired medications might not be effective in treating dogs or parasite prevention and also some expired
medications can make animals sick. Ensure not to use expired medications for animals in the facility.
***Correct from this day forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female bichon (Angel, Microchip#0A02236321, DOB 5/28/2013) was observed to have 3 teeth that were loose to the 
touch (her upper left front tooth, upper left back tooth, and her lower right back tooth (premolar).  On physical exam, the 
attending veterinarian noted that her dental score was a 3 (out of 1-3) and body condition 6/9 on 1/5/23; however the 
licensee said that they have not discussed a treatment plan with the attending veterinarian for the advanced dental 
disease.  Dental disease with teeth that are loose to the touch could  become worse or could be uncomfortable for the dog 
and impact its overall health if not properly treated.   The facility must have this dog's teeth evaluated by the attending 
veterinarian for treatment and follow the treatment plan. 
***Correct by March 8, 2023. 
 
The bottle of pyrantel in the fridge had an expiration date of 7/14/22 and the licensee said it has been used for dogs in the 
facility.  Expired medications might not be effective in treating dogs or parasite prevention and also some expired 
medications can make animals sick.   Ensure not to use expired medications for animals in the facility.  
***Correct from this day forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.

End Section
